Package pool.poolModel

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
pool.poolModel.Ball
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Ball extends Object implements Serializable
This class represents a single ball in the game of billard. Balls can roll over the table, collide with the edges of the table or with another ball or be potted.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • friction

      public void friction()
      This method applies friction to the balls causing them to slow down when rolling.

    • checkTableCollision

      public void checkTableCollision()
      This method check if a ball collides with one of the edges of the table, except the places where a hole is. It then turns the relevant velocity around. If a ball rolls in a hole, its velocity is set to 0 and the location is changed to the left side of the table where the potted balls are displayed.

    • checkBallCollision

      public void checkBallCollision(Ball other)
      This method checks if a ball is colliding with another ball. If so it check if they are overlapping. If this is the case it removes the overlap so that they don't get stuck together. Then it calculates the new direction and velocity of the colliding balls.
      Parameters:
      other - the ball that another ball is colliding with

      public int getBallId()
      This method returns the id of a ball.

      the id of a ball as integer

    • getHitBalls

      public ArrayList<Ball> getHitBalls()

    • setPottedBalls
